params.label: name
params.documentation: Name of the column type as expected by the underlying database, e.g. Unsupported("GEOGRAPHY(POINT,4326)"). This string is not validated by Prisma Migrate and will be used by Prisma Migrate to generate the DDL statements to evolve the database schema. Prisma Introspect will overwrite this when re-introspecting if the type does not match.

blockTypes.label: datasource
blockTypes.documentation: The datasource block tells the schema where the models are backed.

blockTypes.label: generator
blockTypes.documentation: Generator blocks configure which clients are generated and how they're generated. Language preferences and binary configuration will go in here.

blockTypes.label: model
blockTypes.documentation: Models represent the entities of your application domain. They are defined using model blocks in the data model.

blockTypes.label: enum
blockTypes.documentation:
Enums are defined via the enum block. You can define enums in your data model if they're supported by the data source you use:
• PostgreSQL: Supported
• MySQL: Supported
• MariaDB: Supported
• SQLite: Not supported

dataSourceFields.label: provider
dataSourceFields.documentation: Describes which data source connector to use. Can be one of the following built in datasource providers: `postgresql`, `mysql` or `sqlite`.

dataSourceFields.label: url
dataSourceFields.documentation: Connection URL including authentication info. Each datasource provider documents the URL syntax. Most providers use the syntax provided by the database, [learn more](https://www.prisma.io/docs/reference/tools-and-interfaces/prisma-schema).

generatorFields.label: provider
generatorFields.documentation: Describes which generator to use. This can point to a file that implements a generator or specify a built-in generator directly.

generatorFields.label: output
generatorFields.documentation: Determines the location for the generated client, [learn more](https://www.prisma.io/docs/reference/tools-and-interfaces/prisma-schema)

generatorFields.label: binaryTargets
generatorFields.documentation: Specifies the OS on which the Prisma Client will run to ensure binary compatibility of the query engine.

blockAttributes.label: @@map([""])
blockAttributes.documentation: Maps a model name from the Prisma schema to a different table name.

params.label: name
params.documentation: The name of the target database table.

blockAttributes.label: @@id([])
blockAttributes.documentation: Defines a multi-field ID on the model.

blockAttributes.label: @@unique([])
blockAttributes.documentation: Defines a compound unique constraint for the specified fields.

blockAttributes.label: @@index([])
blockAttributes.documentation: Defines an index on the model.

fieldAttributes.label: @id
fieldAttributes.documentation: Defines a single-field ID on the model.

fieldAttributes.label: @unique
fieldAttributes.documentation: Defines a unique constraint for this field.

fieldAttributes.label: @map("")
fieldAttributes.documentation: Maps a field name from the Prisma schema to a different column name.

params.label: name
params.documentation: The name of the target database column.

fieldAttributes.label: @default()
fieldAttributes.documentation: Defines a default value for this field. `@default` takes an expression as an argument.

fieldAttributes.label: @relation()
fieldAttributes.documentation: Defines meta information about the relation. [Learn more](https://www.prisma.io/docs/reference/tools-and-interfaces/prisma-schema/relations#the-relation-attribute).
fieldAttributes.fullSignature: @relation(_ name: String?, fields: FieldReference[]?, references: FieldReference[]?)

params.label: name
params.documentation: Defines the name of the relationship. In an m-n-relation, it also determines the name of the underlying relation table.

params.label: fields
params.documentation: A list of field references of the *current* model.

params.label: references
params.documentation: A list of field references of the model on *the other side of the relation*.

fieldAttributes.label: @updatedAt
fieldAttributes.documentation: Automatically stores the time when a record was last updated.

relationArguments.label: references: []
relationArguments.documentation: A list of field references of the model on *the other side of the relation*.

relationArguments.label: fields: []
relationArguments.documentation: A list of field references of the *current* model.
Defines the name of the relationship. In an m-n-relation, it also determines the name of the underlying relation table.

datasourceUrlArguments.documentation: Connection URL including authentication info. Each datasource provider documents the URL syntax. Most providers use the syntax provided by the database, [learn more](https://www.prisma.io/docs/reference/tools-and-interfaces/prisma-schema).

datasourceUrlArguments.label: env()
datasourceUrlArguments.documentation: Specifies a data source via an environment variable. When running a Prisma CLI command that needs the database connection URL (e.g. `prisma generate`), you need to make sure that the `DATABASE_URL` environment variable is set. One way to do so is by creating a `.env` file. Note that the file must be in the same directory as your schema.prisma file to automatically be picked up by the Prisma CLI.

params.label: environmentVariable
params.documentation: The environment variable in which the database connection URL is stored.

datasourceProviders.label: mysql
datasourceProviders.documentation: Specifies a MySQL data source. Learn more about the MySQL data source connector [here](https://www.prisma.io/docs/reference/database-connectors/mysql).

datasourceProviders.label: postgresql
datasourceProviders.documentation: Specifies a PostGreSQL data source. Learn more about the PostgreSQL data source connector [here](https://www.prisma.io/docs/reference/database-connectors/postgresql).

datasourceProviders.label: sqlite
datasourceProviders.documentation: Specifies a SQLite data source. Learn more about the SQLite data source connector [here](https://www.prisma.io/docs/reference/database-connectors/sqlite).

datasourceProviders.label: sqlserver
datasourceProviders.documentation: Specifies a Microsoft SQL Server data source. Learn more about this connector [here](https://pris.ly/d/mssql-connector)
